results.title: Our wonderful body: medicines, drugs and poisons
results.brief_description: Offers such safety guidelines as the importance of reading labels, following a doctor’s recommendation and the storage of drugs, medicines and household chemicals away from children. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Our inheritance from historic Greece
results.brief_description: Illustrates aspects of modern everyday life which can be traced back to that of the ancient Greeks. Aspects discussed are architecture, dress, ideas such as democracy, word derivations, electricity, zoology, mathematics and botany. Each element is depicted in its present-day use as well as its ancient Greek origin.

results.title: Our heritage
results.brief_description: Shows examples of carvings, statuary and sculpture to be found in religious temples and shrines in the Deccan area of Southern India. Hindu, Buddhist, Bravidiah and Muslem architecture are represented.

results.title: Ottawa, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Planning experts redesigning Ottawa consider its potentialities as a national capital. Animation shows how it began as a lumbering town at the junction of three rivers. Points out some of its undesirable features and shows the master plan embodying good town-planning principles and highlighting its scenic waterways, drives, and Houses of Parliament.

results.title: Ottawa: Canada's capital
results.brief_description: A picture of Ottawa photographed in tulip time. Explores the many beauty spots in and around the city and shows how Ottawa has made use of its many natural endowments to develop a unique capital city.

results.title: The Origins of weather
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Illustrates, from the vantage of off-the-Earth observation, the factors that produce the climate we know. Animation shows the Earth’s dynamic heat exchange—the effect of the sun’s heat, the movement of air masses. Resulting weather is then shown.

results.title: Opus 65
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, A V Curtice, Ford Motor Company and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: An attempt at discovering and expressing a relationship between music and a mechanical process on an abstract level. Richard Arnell was commissioned by the Ford Motor Company to compose a symphonic piece inspired by a visit to their factory. The scriptwriter then wrote a detailed scenario to fit the music, drawing a sketch of every set-up. The resulting film, following the scheme of the music, falls into three movements: The first, a general impression; the second, with the motive of Man versus Machine; the third, climaxing in the actual production of a car.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Taylor, A V Curtice, Ford Motor Company and Wallace Productions

results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film in which both sound and image were created with a minimum of photographic or electronic equipment. results.title: Operation eastbound
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: RAAF jets circle the world in four weeks. Flying from Amberley, Queensland, to refuel in Fiji; seeing the color of Hawaii and its war cemetry. Air force bases in California, Bermuda, Malta are visited on the journey to Lagos, Nigeria, where colorful Independence celebrations attended by Princess Alexandra take place. After a week the men fly home buying gifts at Aden, seeing palm trees at Cocos Islands, passing over Perth in formation, and back to Amberley.
